name: Interact Club
description: A service organization sponsored by the Rotary Club. Members participate in community service projects such as food drives for Clemson Community Care and the Clemson Christmas Parade.
notes: One of the largest clubs on campus with over 125 members.

name: Beta Club
description: National organization promoting the ideals of academic achievement, character, service, and leadership.
notes: Open to sophomores and juniors with an unweighted GPA of 3.5 or higher. Deadline to join is typically in October.

name: Science National Honor Society (SNHS)
description: Honor society for students excelling in science. Members often participate in the SC Region 1 Science Fair and the annual SNHS Research Symposium.
notes: By invitation only to qualifying Juniors and Seniors. Members must maintain high academic standing in science coursework.

name: Research Club
description: A club dedicated to conducting and presenting original student research. Works closely with SNHS and AP Capstone students.
notes: Open to all grades. Prepares students for competitions like the ISEF-affiliated regional science fair.

name: Literary Lions Book Club
description: Student-led book club that meets monthly to discuss books from various genres (e.g., Dystopian, Mystery, Graphic Novels).
notes: Meets monthly in the Library Learning Commons (LLC). Leaders organize events like author visits.

name: Student Council
description: Student government body responsible for organizing school-wide events, spirit weeks, and representing student interests.
notes: Organizes major events like Homecoming and charity drives.

name: Link Crew
description: A high school transition program that welcomes freshmen and makes them feel comfortable throughout the first year of their high school experience.
notes: Juniors and Seniors serve as mentors (Link Leaders) for incoming freshmen.

name: DECA
description: Prepares emerging leaders and entrepreneurs in marketing, finance, hospitality, and management.
notes: You do not have to be a career center student to join.

name: Air Force JROTC
description: Curriculum focuses on leadership, aerospace science, and community service. The cadet corps often leads school ceremonies.
notes: Cadets participate in events like Patriot Day activities and color guard presentations.

name: Lions Pride Marching Band
description: Competitive marching band that performs at football games and competitions.
notes: Frequent state champions (e.g., 2023 State Champions). Includes Color Guard.

name: Chorus / Leo Voces
description: Vocal ensembles performing at school concerts and state assessments.
notes: Includes 'Concert Choir' and the advanced 'Leo Voces' group. Consistently receive 'Superior' ratings at festivals.

name: Strings / Orchestra
description: String orchestra ensemble performing varying repertoires from classical to thematic pop concerts.
notes: Hosts events like the annual 'Costume Concert' in October.

name: Drama / Theatre
notes: Roughly 9% of the student body participates in drama productions.
